content.description: The crux of this route is def. the off- width climbing the last 1/4.
content.protection: pro to 5 inches, no bolts, sling horn or walk off.
content.location:
P1) Climb the dogleg crack in the center of the formation up  to a wide ledge with a large flake, Gear - 3"

cont.

P2) Ascend offwidth crack (crux) to top out. Gear - 5"

Decent

1)-sling horn to rap. back to ledge, - may be too sketchy for some , otherwise

2) walk off (East)  entailing

a) exposed  fourth class moves to rappel bolts note: (60 m rope will just reach the ground w/ stretch)/ or cont. east to decent option

b)  exposed 4th class boulder hopping move to gain access to the walk off.

content.description: Start about 50 feet right of Hueco Wall and climb an obvious, lower angled, left leaning crack.
content.location: Start about 50 feet right of Hueco Wall at an obvious, lower angled, left leaning crack.

content.description: Climb the wide, grainy, left leaning crack to the top.
content.protection: Large cams are needed to protect this route. You'll need at least a red and gold Camalot for the anchor.
content.location: This route is located roughly middway between Aero Space and Jaws on the Inner Wall (Exorcist) side of the Hall of Horrors. About 40 feet to the right of Smurf's Up is an alcove. In the center of this alcove is a wide, left leaning crack. This route is about 20 feet to the right (toward Jaws) from "Unknown", the thin, vertical 5.8- crack.

climbs.name: The Trouble With Tribbles
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Yvonne MacPherson, November 1992

content.description:
Climb the face between Hemroidic Terror and Three Bolts Closer To Divorce past 2 bolts (5.10 moves after each bolt), then cross the arch about 15 feet right of Hemroidic Terror. You can get a 1.5 inch CD just above the arch.

Slab moves (5.7) lead to a horizontal crack about 20 feet higher (2.5-inch CD). Above, the climbing eases.

2-bolt anchor on top (100 foot rappel)
Climb the thin crack that is just right of a right facing chimney/corner. The crux is near the top and a bit spooky.
content.protection: Small cams, TCUs and small wires are needed to protect this short route. For the anchor you'll need at least a red and gold Camalot.
content.location: This route is located roughly middway between Aero Space and Jaws on the East Wall Inner (Exorcist) side of the Hall of Horrors. About 40 feet to the right of Smurf's Up is an alcove. In the left corner of this alcove (closest to Smurf's Up) is a thin, vertical crack. This crack is just right of a right facing chimney/corner.

content.description: This route is located on the East Rock-West Face, right side.This route climbs tricky face past three bolts, to the left of "Rings Around Uranus". Climb past the bolts, then past a horizontal crack and wander up the easy unprotected face above.
content.protection: 3 bolts, some gear in the 1/2"-2" for the horizontal and anchors.

content.description: This route follows a crack which slants up and left.  It has good climbing, but is quite short.  Thin wired nuts protect a few fun, steep moves: face climbing and some pinch/liebacks.
content.location: Left of the large wall containing Jaws is a broken area, and then a long boulder which tapers down to the ground at its right end.  This climb starts half way along that long boulder.

content.description: An unpleasant steep, short finger and hand crack that starts on the block just right (west) of Exorcist and faces north.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3 1/2", gear belay 1-3" cams.  Traverse to Exorcist rappel anchors to descend or down climb southwest.

content.description: This is the thin slab just left of Trouble With Tribbles.

Start about 75 feet right of Aero Space near the left edge of a rectangular shaped varnished face with a prominent horizontal crack. Make hard moves past the first bolt to a second bolt and then the horizontal. One more bolt will get you to the top.
content.protection: Three bolts and some gear in the horizontal crack.
content.location: Start about 75 feet right of Aero Space near the left edge of a rectangular shaped varnished face with a prominent horizontal crack.

content.description: Climb the arching crack to a large block, mount that and then head straight up on slabby face past two bolts to the top. A little runout up high but it gets progressively easier the higher you go. One star out of five.
content.location:
This is the next route right of

Doin' Life

and start from a prominent right-arching crack.

climbs.name: Rings Around Uranus
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Peggy Buckey & Tad Welch, Match 1986

content.description: This route is located on the East Rock-West Face, right side. Climb the right curving crack to the right of  "Three Bolts Closer To Divorce". This is just to the left of some boulders leaning against the main face. Climb up past a horizontal crack, then a bolt and up fun, easy face to the top. The easy face has no protection and a abundance of holds. Many variations are available in this section.

climbs.name: Que?
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Randy Ziedberg, et al

content.description: Start about 20 feet right of What at a short, free-standing pinnacle. This pinnacle/boulder is to the left of the Love Goddess buttress. Starting near the left (What) edge of the front face, climb the front of the pinnacle to the top.
content.protection: Chimney up behind the pinnacle/boulder to set up a top rope for this climb.
content.location: Start about 20 feet right of What at a short, free-standing pinnacle. This pinnacle/boulder is to the left of the Love Goddess buttress.

climbs.name: Nurn's Romp
climbs.fa: Dave Evans and Mike Raab, November 1974

content.description:
This striking crack offers positive jams and excellent gear making it a recommended route of the area. Scramble to the base and climb a flake to a ledge and then up a left-facing corner to reach the crack proper which pulls a small roof on good holds and then continues up a nice hand crack to finish with a lower-angled, slightly wider finish.

The descent can be done by traversing right to anchors atop Exorcist or via a memorable leap across the chasm just left of the climb's finish.
content.protection: Gear to 3" with emphasis on hand-sized pieces
content.location:
The attractive crack 50' left of

Exorcist

.

content.description: Climb the lower (crux) section of Nurn's Romp to reach a large ledge on the right. Climb the face about eight feet right of the upper Nurn's Romp crack (and left of the upper portion of Double Jeopardy) to reach the belay ledge.
content.protection: Small to medium cams are needed to set up the top rope.
content.location: Climb the lower (crux) section of Nurn's Romp to reach a large ledge on the right.

content.description: Crux thin face moves lead up to a fun, easy overhang and and easy face above.
content.protection: two bolts plus gear for the belay
content.location: This is just left of Buenos Aires.

content.description: Scramble up the chossy cracks to reach the base of the block, then crank hard over the cruxy bulge and puzzle out the remainder of the arete. Excellent and unique climbing all the way!
content.protection: 5 bolts with bolted anchors at the top of the block.
content.location: The obvious bolted arete just right of Love Goddess on Troy Block.

climbs.name: Love Goddess
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr and Rob Mulligan, November 1988

content.description:
Four bolts up a steep featured wall on mostly good holds with one stopper move - a flat hold you'll wish was better. Once past continue up easier terrain to anchors.

A fun climb that ascends an impressive formation, it is the easiest of three excellent sport routes. To the immediate right is the tricky arete of Moonshadow (5.12c), and further right the steep, thin face of La Cholla (5.12d).
content.location:
This nice route is found on the north face of a huge block 100' right of

Exorcist

(a striking thin crack starting from a ledge). Scramble/climb onto a large boulder at the base of the route.

content.description:
This unique route is found on the west face of the wall with The Exorcist and Diamond Dogs, but much farther right where the wall is slabby.

Climb up the chimney and after a short distance dive deeper into the depths of the chimney as it becomes a totally enclosed slot. Continue up this to the top and then exit onto a ledge to finish. The descent is to the climber's left.

Pro may be possible on this route, but this is probably better and easier to solo as the climbing is fairly secure and provides good practice for other wide cracks.

climbs.name: It
climbs.fa: Dick Shockley, Tobin Sorenson & Jim Wilson 3/74

content.description: A neat looking dihedral just to the right of the Exorcist. Head up the dihedral with good jams but tenous feet then head up a left facing dihedral once you reach the ledge.
content.location: Immediately right of Exorcist.

content.description: To the right of Rings Around Uranus about 50 feet is a separate wall with an obvious line of steep huecos. Climb up along the huecos/scoops.
content.protection: None, but the route can be top roped.
content.location: To the right of Rings Around Uranus about 50 feet is a separate wall with an obvious line of steep huecos.

climbs.name: Hemroidic Terror
climbs.fa: Matt Cox and Dave Evans, November 1974

content.description:
Follow the marked trail from the parking area to the backside (west face) of the second large rock encountered. This is the same wall with the routes Diamond Dogs and Exorcist, but much further south (right) on a slabby section of rock.

Locate a right-curving arch in the center of the face and begin at it's base. Follow the arch up and out right until feasible to exit onto the face above (make sure to pro under the arch), then run it out to the top on grainy friction.

Not a great route, but it's got some good moves on the face above the arch with your gear out of view under the arch...which keeps it interesting.

climbs.name: Exorcist
climbs.fa: Tobin Sorenson, Jim Wilson, Dick Shockley & Dean Fidelman, February 1974

content.description: Thin jams and a bit of liebacking up a smooth, thin crack characterize the start which protects well with wires and small cams. Higher the crack ends and turns to face climbing past a bolt which protects to the top. Rap from anchors on the ledge above with one rope.
content.location: The obvious striking crack in a recessed area.

climbs.name: Doin' Life
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Kelly Penix, Steve Anderson and Bob Waldrop, 1988

content.description:
This climb lies on the west face of the wall with Exorcist and Diamond Dogs, but at the far right side where it is slabby.

Begin with a right-slanting crack shared with Search For Klingons and continue up slabby face past three bolts. Rap from anchors or continue to the top and walk-off to climber's left.

Not an especially memorable route- just another grainy Josh slab, but than again there are worse routes.

climbs.name: Chesire For President
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Cooper & Hanna Mohn, Chesire Gagnon   04-2004

content.description: Scramble up boulders about eight feet then traverse on a sloping ledge under the ceiling to a vertical crack. Climb the crack through the ceiling (crux), then continue up to the top of the crack. Climb the face above past one bolt to the top.  This was ChesireÂ’s first rock climb (she was 13 years old at the time).
content.location: This climb is located about 100 feet to the right of Wacko Wall and roughly 50 feet left of Ramble On. It is across the gully to the west of Ramble On, below a pillar/boulder with an obvious crack through a ceiling.

climbs.name: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
climbs.fa: Paul Rosenau and Rob Mulligan, September 1985

content.description:
This is a curving finger crack 50 feet to the right (west) of Exorcist.  The rock quality is not the best but the climbing is very nice and the gear is great.

Start up a loose lieback / finger crack that becomes a powerful finger crack traverse straight right where it meets the wide crack of What, 5.8.
content.protection: Standard crack gear, bring extra small cams from 0.25" to 0.5" and a 4" cam for What.  1"-3" cams for the belay.
content.location: Follow the upper finger crack part of IT, 5.9 as a second pitch.  Traverse left (east) to Exorcist's rappel anchors, one rope rap just makes it.

content.description:
Located on the backside (west face) of the second rock west of the parking area. This is found on the far right side where the rock is very slabby.

This is the first route right of a deep chimney system (

Jaws

), and climbs well-protected slabby face past three bolts. Higher as the angle eases a runout on easier terrain leads to top. Rap off anchors or continue to the top and walk-off to climber's left.

A fun route, probably the best slab route on this portion of the rock, which isn't saying a whole lot.

This runout slab route is to be found on the far right side of the same wall as Exorcist and Diamond Dogs.

Carefully climb a long ways up to the first bolt, and then climb past one more bolt before a section of open face leads to the top. Walk-off to climber's left.

Despite the runout on this climb this is one of the better slab climbs on this portion of the wall. Give it a go if in the area, it's reasonably fun and most likely has no queue.
Do the first two moves of Aero Space, then continue up the face to the ridge. Go up and left to the Aero Space anchor.
content.location: Start as for Aero Space.

climbs.name: The Antichrist (aka Small Town, Big Girls)
climbs.fa: (TR) Kevin Thaw, 1988, FL: Hamish Morrison, Mike Rodriguez, Alan Bartlett, 1989

content.description:
Shenanigans like a stick clip help get the first bolt clipped.  Jump or more shenanigans gain the first big hold.  The crux for me was clipping the third bolt.  An extendo-clip quick draw may be handy to overcome the 3rd bolt location issue.

Tall people rejoice.
content.protection: 3 great bolts, 1"-3" cams for belay.  Follow the finger crack second half of It, 5.9 to the bolted rappel anchors of Exorcist to the left.  One 60 meter rope just makes it.
content.location: This is the short, juggy 3 bolt face right of the start of Exorcist and It.

content.description: This is a short, but very sustained thin crack 200 feet right (west) of Exorcist.  Very nice climbing, clean and good protection.
content.protection: Small stoppers, small cams to 2".  No micro-nuts.  Bolted belay/rappel.
content.location: This route faces northwest and gets afternoon sun.
